description: A transaction type that hasn't been identified or categorized.
Granting permission for a smart contract to spend your tokens.
Sending tokens to another address.
Receiving tokens from another address.
Converting a cryptocurrency into its wrapped version.
Converting a wrapped token back to its original cryptocurrency.
Exchanging one type of token for another.
Sending tokens from one address to another.
Executing a limit order by buying or selling tokens at the specified price or better.
Canceling an existing limit order that is expired or hasn't been filled fully.
Canceling an active limit order.
Providing tokens to a liquidity pool to facilitate trading and earn rewards.
Withdrawing tokens from a liquidity pool.
Taking out a loan in the form of tokens from a lending protocol.
Returning borrowed tokens to a lending protocol.
Locking tokens in a protocol to earn rewards or participate in governance.
Withdrawing staked tokens from a protocol.
Casting a vote on a proposal in a decentralized governance system.
Assigning your voting power to another address to vote on your behalf.
Revoking the assignment of your voting power from a delegate.
Invalidating or withdrawing a previously cast vote.
Retrieving rewards or tokens that are due to you.
Performing a specific function or task within a smart contract.
Transferring tokens across different blockchains.
Purchasing an NFT from the marketplace.
Placing a bid on an NFT in an auction.
Making an offer to sell an NFT you own.
Permanently removing tokens from circulation.
A Gnosis Safe transaction which can include one or more multisigned transactions.
Registering a human-readable name on the Ethereum Name Service (ENS) to associate with your address.
Withdrawing previously granted permissions or approvals.
Creating a multisig Gnosis Safe Wallet.
Adding a new owner to a multisig Gnosis Safe Wallet.
A transaction that involves multiple steps or stages, often used in complex operations.
